title: Pelé's funeral to take place Monday, Tuesday in hometown Santos
description: Outgoing Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro also declared three days of national mourning for Pelé.

title: Vivienne Westwood, fashion maverick, has died at 81
description: The style icon who played a key role in the punk movement, died on Thursday, December 29.

title: Space: The search for a solution to clean up orbits
description: The world's major space agencies are becoming increasingly concerned with the issue of debris recovery.

title: Pelé tributes pour in: 'He transformed football into an art'
description: 'Before Pelé, football was just a sport. Pelé changed everything,' hailed Brazil's Neymar. 'His legacy will never be forgotten,'  assured the star of the French team, Kylian Mbappé.

title: Myanmar faces humanitarian emergency
description: Almost two years after a military coup, the number of internally displaced is surging while international aid, subject to increasingly strict controls, is trickling.

title: Pelé: 'I freed all Brazilian football players from slavery'
description: On January 10, 2012, Pelé spoke with 'Le Monde' at length. We are republishing the interview following his  death on December 29, 2022.

title: Pelé: Outside of football, the King's political stances were not always popular
description: The Brazilian, who died on December 29, 2022, was often criticized, during and after his career, for his closeness to authoritarian figures and his business dealings. He was the minister of sports from 1995 to 1999 and even once hoped to become president.

title: Death of Pelé: The 'strange rivalry' with Maradona
description: Throughout their lives, the Brazilian and the Argentine had a bitter-sweet relationship, as they battled to be remembered as the best footballer ever.

title: King Pelé, legend of world football, has died aged 82
description: Edson Arantes do Nascimento, better known as Pelé, was the undisputed king of the game and the only player to have won three World Cups, in 1958, 1962 and 1970.

title: In Lebanon, banks and supermarkets rely on private security
description: The increase in violent incidents and pickpocketing in recent months against the backdrop of the severe economic, financial and social crisis, is fueling the demand for institutional protection.

title: Djokovic can't forget Australian deportation but wants to move on
description: Tennis star Novak Djokovic has returned to Australia almost a year after being kicked out for refusing to be vaccinated against Covid-19.

title: Bolivia prosecutor seeks 6-month detention for opposition leader
description: Luis Fernando Camacho had been under investigation for his role in the strikes and also in violent protests in response to Evo Morales' disputed election to a fourth term.

title: 'When you hear only one boom, it's bad. When there are several, it's good': The diary of two sisters separated by the war in Ukraine
description: This week, Olga feels out of step as the carefree holiday season begins in France. Sasha, who is suffering from an illness, experienced the most intense missile attack on Kyiv since the beginning of the war. For the 43rd week, the two Ukrainian sisters recount their daily lives to Le Monde's 'M' magazine.

title: Prominent Algeria journalist El Kadi has been detained
description: Ihsane El Kadi has been placed in pretrial detention and faces up to seven years in prison.

title: Walter Casagrande Jr: 'The fracture between Brazilians and their football team is huge'
description: The divorce between the Seleçao and the Brazilian people has less to do with the poor performance at the Qatar World Cup than with the players being out of touch with their country, says former Brazil international Walter Casagrande Jr.

title: 'The Fierce One' returns as Nepalese prime minister
description: Pushpa Kamal Dahal, the former leader of the Maoist rebellion, lived in hiding for more than a decade before ending his armed struggle in 2006.

title: EU believes mandatory Covid checks for travelers from China 'unjustified'
description: Italy was the first European country to introduce mandatory Covid-19 tests for travellers arriving from China.

title: Netanyahu sworn in as PM of most right-wing government in Israel's history
description: This will be the sixth term in office for the experienced politician but he will be ruling over the country's most hard-line and religiously conservative government.

title: Brazil: Lula appoints Amazon defender Marina Silva as environment minister
description: The appointment confirms the president-elect's determination to prioritize the rainforest even if agribusiness interests oppose this.

title: Germany: Repeal of anti-Covid rules sparks debate
description: Following virologist Christian Drosten's claim that the pandemic is over, policymakers called for the early lifting of mask-wearing rules in public transport and medical practices.

title: French newspapers hit hard by soaring paper and energy costs
description: Most national dailies, including 'Le Monde', will be raising the prices of their paper editions on January 1, 2023.

title: Musician Angel Maxine gives voice to Ghana's stigmatized LGBT+ community
description: As the only openly transgender musician in the West African country, the singer uses her art to support sexual minorities.

title: Education: France has the largest class sizes in the European Union
description: A recent study by the statistical service of the Ministry of Education highlights a deteriorating situation that particularly affects secondary school.

title: Israel: Netanyahu presents government putting far right in power
description: The new coalition gives pride of place to Jewish extremists and the ultra-Orthodox, who plan to weaken the judiciary and expand settlements.

title: 2022, a pivotal year for the environment
description: The year is closing with a series of agreements on climate and biodiversity, but the commitments remain insufficient and implementing them will prove hard.

title: How Poland is increasingly cutting itself off from Russia
description: Barbed wire along the border with the Kaliningrad enclave, a new canal to bypass Russian waters and the halting of visas: Since the outbreak of war in Ukraine, Warsaw has moved further and further away from Moscow.

title: Historian Alexis Levis on Elon Musk: 'Absolute freedom of speech always benefits the far right'
description: The media historian argues that behind the billionaire's antics – from suspending journalists' accounts to threatening employees – lurks the ever-present strategy of the far right in dealing with the media.

title: Croatia braces for major logistical challenge of changing currencies
description: The country is set to become the eurozone's 20th member from January 1, 2023. For banks and businesses, the transition requires considerable work.

title: Italo Bettiol, creator of French children's series 'Chapi Chapo', has died at 96
description: Italo Bettiol was a specialist in stop motion, which consists of 'animating foam and felt puppets frame by frame in front of the camera'. His series 'Chapi Chapo' was broadcast worldwide.

title: Covid-19: With no common strategy for travelers from China, Europe risks infections spike
description: France is still considering 'appropriate measures,' while Italy, Japan and the United States are imposing mandatory testing.

title: Ukraine reports 'massive' Russian missile attack across country
description: The latest barrage of missiles wounded at least three people in Kyiv and left 90% of the city of Lviv without power.

title: 'Anti-Covid protests in China were inspired by SARS protests in Hong Kong'
description: The unprecedented protest movements against the Chinese government are more reminiscent of those that took place in 2003 in the former British colony, following the SARS epidemic, than those of the 1989 Beijing Spring.

title: Private practitioners go on strike, in spite of French government's warnings
description: An informal group of doctors called for practices to close from December 26 to January 2, 2023. Not all the unions followed, and the health minister criticized the action.

title: Linda de Suza, French-Portuguese singer, has died at 74
description: Her autobiographical book 'La Valise en Carton', a rare testimony on Portuguese immigration to France, remains one of her greatest achievements.

title: Lack of staff puts Brittany region health service in dire straits
description: Tension is at its peak in hospitals throughout France. In Brittany, saturated services have to close at night because of understaffing, while restrictions are tightened.

title: At Paris's Pathé Parnasse cinema, wider seats come with higher prices
description: With the reopening of its multiplex in Paris, Jérôme Seydoux's group continues to upgrade its theaters.

title: DRC: After floods kill 169 people, Kinshasa's chaotic urbanization is blamed
description: Only a quarter of the megalopolis of 15 million people has a development plan, and many buildings are built in disaster-prone areas.

title: Cambodia: Ten people killed and 30 injured in hotel-casino blaze
description: The fire at the Grand Diamond City casino-hotel in Poipet, on the border of Thailand, broke out late Wednesday night at around 11:30 pm local, Cambodian police said.

title: As Croatia joins, growing Eurozone faces new challenges
description: With Croatia joining the eurozone on January 1, 2023, the single-currency bloc will count 20 members. Is there a risk of them being too heterogenous?

title: From war to the euro: Croatia's 30-year reconstruction
description: Croatia will join the eurozone and the Schengen area on January 1, 2023, in a turning point for a country that was at war in the 1990s.

title: Kosovo Serbs will remove barricades that triggered tensions
description: The agreement was reached at a late-night crisis meeting with the leaders of Kosovo Serbs, Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic said on Wednesday.
